question: 幼い
sourceMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>infancy</kanji>. The adjective version refers more to your entire child-times, including baby times. But, if you're described as being like a child from child times, what are you called? <vocabulary>Childish</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

When you were <vocabulary>childish</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>immature</vocabulary> you were sent off to do prayers to ask for forgiveness. One of the things you had to do was sing "<reading>hosanna</reading> (<ja>おさな</ja>) in the highest."
